data:
CONTEXT
Student Athlete Network was established with the mission of  
"Providing a service assisting student athletes in progressing their dual careers." 

In order to try to fulfill this mission the company works towards five Key Objectives. 
1. Assist student athletes in finding an unrivaled experience.
2. Centralise all potential career progression routes for student athletes
3. Provide opportunities at various stages of the student athlete pathway
4. Open up non traditional and international student athlete opportunities
5. Provide the opportunities for student athletes to succeed in their chosen path

OBJECTIVES
The project intends to provide opportunities to recent AASE basketball apprenticeship graduates.  It will do that through the stated key objectives of 
- Aid the transfer of European training methods, development environments, techniques and philosophies into recent graduates
- Expose students to European opportunities in both sport and other careers so they can be explored and pursued in the future.
-Embedding lifelong learning principles and working cultures to give students with the skills to pursue employment, either within sport or outside of it, throughout their career.

NUMBER AND PROFILE OF PARTICIPANTS

The AASE basketball program currently caters for up to 150 students per year nationally within the UK.  Approximately 71% of these students are Male with 65% from Black and Minority Ethnic (BME) groups

PROJECT ACTIVITIES

The main project activities will incorporate daily individual and team training sessions, and weekly games in the Portuguese league, either Proliga (2nd Division) or CNB1 (3rd division). In line with SLS holistic approach to developing their athletes the selected participants will also receive strength & conditioning sessions, medical support, monthly goal setting meetings, sports psychology and nutrition advice. SLS will also provide the participants with weekly Portuguese language lessons to help them immerse themselves in the community. 


METHODOLGY

To ensure that the overarching objectives and participant specific aims of the project are achieved and that success can be measured, Student Athlete Network will use the principles of the European Quality Charter for Mobility to set goals and define tasks for the following key elements of the project:

- INFORMATION AND GUIDANCE
- LEARNING PLAN
- PERSONALISATION
- PREPARATION.
- LANGUAGE
- LOGISTICS
- MENTORING
- RECOGNITION
- EVALUATION
- RESPONSIBILITIES

The expected results of the project on participants, participating organisations and target groups are outlined below:

IMPACT
The impact on participants will be linked to the defined participant specific aims of the project. 

To improve knowledge of lifelong learning principles within participants.
To improve understanding of European opportunities in sport and other careers.
To deliver a high quality social and cultural program including the use of basic language within the host country.
To increase migration from England to Europe either as athletes and/or in alternative career in 2018 and beyond.

- Direct participation of a professional club structure within Portgual.  Allowing students to discuss with those currently employed at that level, improving the knowledge and background of how that they achieve that goal. 

- Improved knowledge and understanding of lifelong learning principles within participants that are tailored to each individual participant and can be applied throughout their education and professional careers.

- Delivery of a high quality social and cultural program will enhance the cultural and linguistic skills of students, facilitating openness to new opportunities both in the UK and Europe.

- Improved knowledge and understanding of the European opportunities in sport and other careers, with the ultimate goal of achieving migration from England to Europe either as athletes and/or in alternative career paths in 2017 and beyond.

- First hand experience of observing and engaging with world class basketball players in a high performance environment, something they are not able to do in the UK.
